title: We have a champion rating system, probably the only good game that has one, or only game.
body:
How come it is not actually utilised for anything other than "Look at me, look at me!"? It could be handy in ranked to use it to give or take players ranking from them, right?

I mean, if you play selfish, even with a moderate score and tons of CS, you could still have a low score. I have seen players with bad CS, no kills, but tons of assists and decent stats get A or better and players with lots of kills, but bad CS and whatnot have a bad score.

Question is, how does the scoring system actually work? Does it take ALL stats and calculate your worth to the team and give you a rank based on that?

OK, so I just read up on it, and it seems good, works out the champion, role, stats and whatnot against other players in the same situation in your region and gives you a score.

So how come we don't use it for anything useful? It would be nice if it calculated your Elo, a C would give nothing, C+ a bit of rank and C- lose a bit and so on, or thereabouts.

replies.body: They might change some things for the 2016 season, probably wouldn't want to make significant changes in the middle of this ranked season.
